article:
Christine hoped to find a place to study where western values mixed with the values of other cultures. This is exactly what she 26 _  in Australia, and it helped her to grow as a doctor. Christine uses a single word to   _   the quality of the education she received in Australia--superior. It has been over a year since she   _   her postgraduate studies and returned to Taiwan, but Christine's   _   of the time she spent here are still strong.
"The multicultural society   _   me to be a more open-minded person and it helps a lot in my career, " she said. "Australia was a good place for me to learn how to combine different cultures, either in my work or my classes. Most of the professors and   _   speakers I met were professional and perfect. They have   _   experiences in teaching and in their own fields. All of the knowledge is up-to-date," she said.
The factors which influenced Christine's   _   to study in Australia include the multicultural environment, the worldwide recognition of many of its degrees and the fact that Australia is an English-speaking country. "The most important point is that a degree 34 _  in Australia will be recognized all over the world. I am 35 _  in working for European and American firms, therefore the overseas education background is very   _  ," she said. "For a woman who has a doctor degree and western education it is very easy to find a good job in Taiwan," she said. "Globalization is the   _   idea for all higher degree education in Taiwan." Christine also has some useful   _   for future students. "You must have the ability of self-management. It is better that you have working experiences in your field and a clear   _   for studying in Australia, then you will benefit a lot from Australia postgraduate education and can   _    success in your career."
